intro: Solena tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded solena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are usually pale blue or violet and attract various pollinators.
